body_content.explanation: involving several countries having most of the power:
examples: The President spoke of a multi-polar world.
The world financial system is becoming multipolar.

body_content.explanation: (of a cell) having several structures projecting (= sticking out) from it:
examples: The cell is multipolar, with one axon and multiple dendrites.
One broad category in our research involves multipolar cells.

body_content.explanation: consisting of several parts, choices, etc., especially when these are very different to each other:
examples: We need a way to deal with multi-polar questions.
Some legal proceedings are by nature more multipolar.
